pageContext.claim: “In the trade deal [USMCA], which assuming it gets approved, Mexico's paying hundreds of billions of dollars over a period of time more than they were paying previously.”
pageContext.analysis: No independent analysis supports Trump's claim that Mexico would be paying hundreds of billions of dollars more under the USMCA than under NAFTA. The USMCA is mostly a revision of NAFTA, not a wholesale rewrite. In any case, countries do not make or lose money on trade. Trade balances simply reflect what consumers in one country chose to buy from another country.
